section.title: What is &virt-scenario;?
section.para: &virt-scenario; is a tool that helps you create a &vmguest; suitable for a specific scenario. It uses predefined profiles that include optimal set of settings for each scenario. You can override settings that are common to all profiles.

important.para: Although &virt-scenario; generally provides the best possible configuration for a specific scenario, this cannot be guaranteed because each environment may have specific requirements.

After the configuration is validated, &virt-scenario; adjusts the &vmhost; system and creates the image file for the &vmguest;. You can then operate the &vmguest; using standard &libvirt; commands.

listitem.para: Fine-tuned profiles already offer optimal set of settings for specified scenarios. You do not have to search and copy them to each virtual machine of the same type, just use the same profile.
The override mechanism lets you specify different values than the profile's default for selected options. This way you can customize virtual machines to your needs.
